channel.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
channel.description:
I got the chance to play the battlefield bad company 2 beta on the pc with some friends, and we recorded how far destruction can go.
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9R3MSsgPr38[/url] :frowning:

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: Coolm4n
item.description:
Imonfire:

That game must require one hell of a CPU to handle all this stuff.

Indeed. I only run it at 25/30 FPS at the highest settings with 4x antialiasing on a 22" (1680x1050) with the following specs:

-Intel C2Q Q6600
-EVGA GTX 260 Core 216
-EVGA 780i FTW
-Corsair 2x2GB PC8500

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: RabidMonkey
item.description:
It’s a beta, not a demo. I think their reasoning behind not releasing it to the public is that they’re actively soliciting feedback on the beta version before the release - if they opened it up to everyone then they would have a lot more crap to wade through (not to mention people complaining and claiming they’ll never purchase the game because they’re basing their decisions off of an unfinished beta version) - I’m sure they’ll release a demo version once the actual game ships which should give people a chance to see whether they like it or not if they’re on the fence about buying it; at this point I see it as more of a little bonus for those who preordered, or were lucky to get a beta key. Is early access to the unfinished game (to play one map/game type, mind you) that big of a deal?

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Well, it’s too late for Infinity Ward, but Bungie split from Microsoft soon after Halo 3 was released. Reach is going to be their last Halo game. They will then work on new IPs and it’s about time they did.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

You not only pissed off every Halo hater on the forums by calling Halo 1 revolutionary, but also pissed off every PC fanboy for implying that online multiplayer on consoles is a good thing (don’t get me wrong. MP on consoles is great. I’m referring to fanboys with massive e-penises), and anyone who liked 3, ODST, and can’t wait for Reach.
Halo 3’s multiplayer is near perfect. And the only downside to ODST was the price and the lack of matchmaking for Firefight. Everything else about the game was gold.

I’m a PC gamer by default, but theres no denying that Halo 1 changed the way the game was played, just as theres no denying Half-Life changed the game.

Halo didn’t revolutionize the FPS genre, just the FPS genre on the consoles.

BUNGIE and Infinity ward have become the most money-grubbing over rated developers in the industry. I was tricked by both companies into buying their latest products. I bought MW2 on the PC (as i no longer have a 360, and prefer FPS on the PC) only to be disappointed, and i waited online and bought Halo 3 in 2007 only to be disappointed. The fact remains that they both Sold Out big time. It was probably due to Microsoft and Activision corrupting them but they sold out none the less.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Imonfire:

You better be trollin’ son.

What? You don’t like blowing shit up?

Imonfire:

What makes a game good is not technological features like this. Crysis is not the best game ever because you can cut trees in half and make sheds explode, eh?

I’ve been a major gameplay>graphics/technology advocate for a long time.
Destroying a sniper’s camping spot on top of a large building with a few grenades/C4/rockets/Crysis or anything else that blows, in my opinion, is a great example of technology being used for better gameplay.

Imonfire:

BF2 is considered by many the best because it is balanced. There is no overpowered weapons, the maps are extremely well designed and the vehicles are easy to drive, but hard to master.

So what’s your beef with Bad Company 2, then?

Deutscher Scharfschütze:

Halo 1 was an amazing, revolutionary game, Halo 2 pushed multiplayer on the consoles, Halo 3, ODST and reach were created to make money, period.

You not only pissed off every Halo hater on the forums by calling Halo 1 revolutionary, but also pissed off every PC fanboy for implying that online multiplayer on consoles is a good thing (don’t get me wrong. MP on consoles is great. I’m referring to fanboys with massive e-penises), and anyone who liked 3, ODST, and can’t wait for Reach.
Halo 3’s multiplayer is near perfect. And the only downside to ODST was the price and the lack of matchmaking for Firefight. Everything else about the game was gold.

Deutscher Scharfschütze:

They’ve already announced they’ve abandoned dedicated servers.

They said they’re considering it. They’re not even sure if RAGE will have multiplayer.

Deutscher Scharfschütze:

Max Payne was the first PS2 game i owned, i have been a fan of GTA since it’s inception. i had GTA when it first came out, i saw them switch to the PS2, i was OK with that, then they switched to the 360, which ever platform they primarily develop for, they fuckover the others.

https://ps3.ign.com/articles/106/1065007p1.html
A bit too late, but better late than never.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

DICE? If Bad Company 2 is awesome, I don’t see how that is.

[COLOR=‘Red’]Catering to the 360 by giving anybody with LIVE a free BETA whilst other platforms have to pre-order.

IW? Defiantly sold out… but I still like MW2.

Bungie?!?! Pffft. On what grounds?

[COLOR=‘red’]Halo 1 was an amazing, revolutionary game, Halo 2 pushed multiplayer on the consoles, Halo 3, ODST and reach were created to make money, period.

ID? That’s only because they haven’t made an in-house game since DOOM 3. Just wait until RAGE or DOOM 4 comes out.

[COLOR=‘red’]They’ve already announced they’ve abandoned dedicated servers.

Ubisoft? Well, it’s a publisher, so I can’t really tell.

[COLOR=‘red’]They gave Red Storm Entertainment the back seat and shifted the majority of work to Ubisoft Montreal who have butchered a lot of franchises.

EPIC? Defiantly. They abandoned their PC fans and fucked up their relationship with their new 360 fans with Gears of War 2’s awful multiplayer lag.

Rockstar? …show me a GTA game that sucks, and I’ll consider it.

[COLOR=‘Red’]Max Payne was the first PS2 game i owned, i have been a fan of GTA since it’s inception. i had GTA when it first came out, i saw them switch to the PS2, i was OK with that, then they switched to the 360, which ever platform they primarily develop for, they fuckover the others.

I’d love to try Bad Company 2 out right now, but i can’t just login to LIVE and download it, i’d have to buy it first. do you see the level of unfairness there? I’m not going to buy something just to try it. Thats the kind of arrogance that makes people torrent shit.

Why does the 360 get an open BETA while the PS3 and PC have to buy the game first?

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

Battlefield? No. Not when they’re introducing new awesome features like destructible environments to the game.

You better be trollin’ son. What makes a game good is not technological features like this. Crysis is not the best game ever because you can cut trees in half and make sheds explode, eh? BF2 is considered by many the best because it is balanced. There is no overpowered weapons, the maps are extremely well designed and the vehicles are easy to drive, but hard to master.

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
im talking about how on a economic and moral level, they have made there company all about money where they started out all about the passion of gaming. I’m not talking about “360 sucks” or anything like that, they have just completely abandoned what used to make their companies great. I’ve watched it time and time again, i just hope Valve stays true with their devotion.

DICE, BUNGIE, IW, ID, Ubisoft, EPIC, Rockstar they are all selling out and have fallen down a slippery slope as developers. Due to this, I is sad.

I hope the up and coming developers like Tripwire stay good for a while.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad Company 2 Destruction
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Well, it is a PC franchise at heart, and it looks like DICE is trying school Infinity Ward in how to get PC gamers to like them by announcing dedicated server support right after IW announced they will not, and if the beta runs well, I see no reason why they would fuck up the final product.
